result.execSummary:
The defendant James Michael Ratzell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  AODA and any follow through treatment per agent.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances.  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  Take/maintain any prescriptions as prescribed.  Inform agent w/in 24 hours if a prescription is received.  Not to be in any bars/taverns/liquor stores.  Random UA's per agent.  Two (2) days credit if probation would be revoked.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Michael Ratzell

records.addlTxt:
11:10 AM Defendant James Michael Ratzell in court.  Attorney Reed Cornia in court for James Michael Ratzell.  Attorney Natalia J Gess in court for State of Wisconsin.  State states the joint recommendations.  Atty Cornia is in agreement.  DE also agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  State confirms they are in compliance w/victim notification rights and there is no request for restitution.  Atty Cornia makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  AMENDED to Misd. Battery - Guilty
Ct 2:  Guilty
Probation for 2 years
Costs/surcharges of $443.00 x 2 to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA samples to be provided
Conditions of probation:
AODA and any follow through treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances
Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription
Take/maintain any prescriptions as prescribed
Inform agent w/in 24 hrs if a prescription is received
Not to be in any bars/taverns/liquor stores
Random UA's per agent
Two (2) days credit if probation would be revoked

Atty Cornia acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and pleads NG.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG pleas.  Court confirms DE's address.  Atty Cornia requests TSC or RD be set out.  Bond continued.

10:44 AM Defendant James Michael Ratzell in court.  Attorney Reed Cornia in court for James Michael Ratzell.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Cornia states DE will waive his right to prelim today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.
